title: C1X ropes in Kartik Mehta to lead its mobile business in India
text: Silicon Valley-based advertising and marketing technology company C1X ( C1Exchange ) has roped in Kartik Mehta to lead its mobile business in India. He will be based out of Mumbai.Kartik’s appointment will enable C1X to expand its operations in one of its largest strategic growth markets globally. With growing business across direct Indian clients and working with supply and operation teams closely.He will operate out of Mumbai office and will report to Narayan Murthy Ivaturi , vice president & head of mobile business- APMEA.On the appointment, Narayan Murthy Ivaturi,mentioned “We are very pleased to have Kartik on board.His breadth of experience across the technology industry will help us develop and execute a long-term plan for growth acceleration in India.”Commenting on his new role,Kartik said,“I am both honored and excited to be a part of the C1X family and strongly resonating with C1X’s values of speed and team work. I am eagerly looking forward to work alongside a fabulous team and help redefine standards in the programmatic space.”Kartik comes with a rich experience of 14 years that includes both agency and sales. He started his career in Advertising and worked with agencies like Bates , JWT and Cheil WW . He also has functional experience in CRM and Digital in his tenure. His mobile experience started with Vserv where he was a part of global markets team. He then moved to Indonesia to be a country head. In his last assignment he was mobile business lead for YouAppi - an Israeli startup for India and South East Asia business.Further on the growth of Mobile, Narayan Murthy Ivaturi stated that"Mobile has been the single largest growing component of the digital ecosystem. It is consistent across any geo- developed, emerging or developing irrespective of any economic trend. Mobile advertising has been taking baby steps in comparison to the explosive growth that the device ecosystem has seen. But over the last 2-3 years with evolved user identifiers we are seeing a huge trend in mobile audience and targeting."
